abstract: An article on Tuesday about the quarterly earnings report of HSBC Holdings, Europe’s biggest bank, referred incorrectly to the impact the turmoil in the American subprime mortgage market has had on financial services companies. They have lost more than $320 billion in asset value through write-downs; they have not lost that much in profit.

They have lost more than $320 billion in asset value through write-downs; they have not lost that much in profit.
